content.description: A strange start crossing slick slabby blocks to the right leads to a gently steep wall.  Trend up and left on sustained moves eventually gaining better holds and rests and ultimately, the anchors.  Decent route but some of the rock is still "eroding" but not chossy by Gorge standards.

climbs.name: Junior Achievement
climbs.fa: Scott Ayers, Jay Ladin, Mike Strassman, 1989

content.description:
Mantle into the thin corner. Step up into thin locks and reach up and left to good holds. Swerve right then back left across the seam and finger crack. Nice patina slab to finish.

Fantastic and varied route. Really packs a punch.

Love it or hate it sort of route. I love it.

Certainly harder by modern gorge standards than the boldschool 11d assigned to the route elsewhere.
content.location: Left of Dimples. Obvious beautiful seam.

content.description: Cruxes above the first bolt and near the end. Face and steep crack.Â  sustained.
content.location: Left most route on the gently overhanding shield.

content.description: Tenuous! Well at least the last 20 or so feet are. Or maybe it's just because one is spoiled with the previous abundance of positive holds on the arete down lower. The pitch starts up a low angled right facing corner protected by 2 bolts. The first one seemed unnecessary and the second seemed to low and would have been better out on the face to the left. The third bolt is hard to reach for those of us with t-rex arms but protects a few difficult moves getting on the arete. At this point you know, game on. A 2 finger pocket helps if you find it. Thoughtful movement along the arete help you link one jug to the next but eventually, somewhere around the 11th or 12 bolt, your luck runs out and you'r left with the question, do I go left or do I go right? I will leave that up to you to decide although I am not sure one way is better than the other. At this point I am  unsure if I loved or hatted this route. I guess I just don't like that insecure feeling of feeling insecure. There are ample bolts so a fall is no big deal. In the end if you figure out the puzzles of getting from bolt to bolt without falling you will also wonder if you loved it too. Nice route Kelly.
content.protection: 14 bolts but you could easily skip the first. You could skip the second as well but it might keep you off the ground if you fall trying to clip the third.
content.location: Left hand side of the Junior Wall up the obvious clean low angle right facing corner and just right of a steep right leaning crack/seam that makes up the route Junior Achievement.

content.description:
Pitch 1: 10c, 70', 9 bolts. Start as for Dimples. Backclean or extend second bolt. Tricky boulder problem over bulge, keep an eye out for good two finger pockets. Break left at the fifth bolt out the patina corner, use good edges, pockets, and the nice crack. Shares anchor with Junior Acheivement at a nice stance.

Pitch 2: 10a, 80', 10 bolts. Follow bolt line up into shallow right facing corner with good edges and pockets. At top of corner, step up and left to crack system with more good pockets. Follow crack to anchor on nice stance on top of pillar.

Link into an awesome mega pitch with 20 draws and extension.
content.protection:
Pitch 1: 9 bolts

Pitch 2: 10 bolts

If linking: 20 bolts, bring a few slings
content.location:
Junior Area

Start as for Dimples
